{"step_by_step_thinking": "AIDS is a condition caused by HIV infection, which weakens the immune system. Secondary infections are common in individuals with AIDS due to their compromised immune system. Rubella, HSV, Candida, and Kaposi's sarcoma are all known to occur as secondary infections in individuals with AIDS. Therefore, none of the options (A, B, C, D) can be excluded as a secondary infection in AIDS.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
